alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Franklin; Licking (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 2:07PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, SOUTHEASTERN DELAWARE AND CENTRAL LICKING COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM EDT... At 207 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Johnstown, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Newark, Reynoldsburg, Gahanna, Granville, Pataskala, Johnstown, Utica, Beechwood Trails, Granville South, Summit Station, New Albany, Jersey, Alexandria, Hartford, St. Louisville, Fredonia, US Route 62 at State Route 661, Purity and State Route 310 at State Route 161. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
